title: A Pilot Study to Assess the Effect of Adding 1 Infusion of Human Mesenchymal Stem Cells (hMSC) to the Treatment of Patients Suffering Agitation/Aggression or Other Behavioral Abnormalities From Alzheimer's Disease.
description_brief: The purpose of this research study is to test if adding one infusion of mesenchymal stem cells to the current treatment with antipsychotic medication may help control behavioral problems in people with a diagnosis of moderate to severe Alzheimer's disease.
drug: Human mesenchymal stem cells (hMSC) — allogeneic, single intravenous infusion (approx. 25 million cells)
